user.title: Set up IR floor heating
user.description: Configure dual-sensor IR floor heating control with Time Proportional & Integral (TPI) algorithm

init.title: Configure IR floor heating
init.description: Advanced configuration for dual-sensor TPI control

data_description.max_floor_temp: Maximum allowed floor surface temperature (material safety limit). For engineered wood/laminate: 27-28°C
data_description.max_floor_temp_diff: Maximum allowed temperature difference between floor and room (comfort limit). Prevents thermal shock and 'hot feet' sensation
data_description.min_cycle_duration: Minimum on/off time per cycle. Protects mechanical relay from excessive wear. Typical: 60 seconds
data_description.cycle_period: TPI cycle duration. Standard: 900 seconds (15 min = 4 cycles/hour) for 10+ year relay life
data_description.boost_mode: Temporarily relax differential limit when room is far from target to enable faster warm-up
data_description.boost_temp_diff: Temperature error threshold to activate boost mode. When (target - room) > this value, differential limit is relaxed
data_description.safety_hysteresis: Hysteresis band for safety limits. Prevents rapid on/off cycling when temperature is near the limit. Typical: 0.5°C
data_description.pid_kp: Proportional gain: Response to current temperature error. Higher = faster response but may overshoot. Default: 10.0
data_description.pid_ki: Integral gain: Eliminates steady-state error over time. Higher = faster elimination but may cause overshoot. Default: 0.5
data_description.pid_kd: Derivative gain: Dampens rate of change. Higher = less overshoot but may slow response. Default: 2.0
